result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Sean Michael Bussiere was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to sign up for Probation while incarcerated.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and.or therapy.

miscConds.notes: Apply money on file and balance through current payment paln.
Blood draw added to current payment plan.

-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Sean Michael Bussiere appeared.  Court called at 2:17 p.m.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  State advises there is not an agreement.  Court proceeds with the Plea Hearing.  Attorneys will argue sentencing.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt merges in and dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 15CF566
S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 7 months in the St. Croix County Jail 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- 27 month driver's license revocation
- 27 month IID
- Huber for work release and to go to Family Therapy Associates in New Richmond for DE's mental health appointments
- Court costs of $1744.00 apply money on file and DE to meet with the payment clerk for remaining balance
- $85.50 for the blood draw
- DE to provide a DNA sample
- DE to sign up for probation while incarcerated
- 20 days to appeal
Final notice sent, due 5-26-16. cah
Final notice sent, due 4-28-16. cah
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Sean Michael Bussiere appeared.  Court called at 10:13 a.m.  There is an agreement.  Attorney DeMaio advises the court the DE is asking for time to get his personal affairs in order before he is sentenced.  DE has completed a 30 day treatment program.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10;15 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 03-25-2016 10:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Sean Michael Bussiere appeared.  Court called at 3:22 p.m. Set for arraignment.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads not guilty on all counts.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:23 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Sean Michael Bussiere appeared.  Court called.  Set for preliminary hearing.  S/T of Officer Nicolas Cramlet of the New Richmond Police Department.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by Officer Cramlet.  Cross by Attorney DeMaio.  Witness excused.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
